channel.title: Technology on d:tour
channel.description: Recent content in Technology on d:tour

item.title: Heliboard
item.description: Jonny had always been curious about open-source technology, so when he heard about the open-source Heliboard keyboard for his phone, he decided to give it a try. The idea of using an open-source keyboard for enhanced privacy intrigued him, promising a level of data security that the default keyboard just couldn’t offer. He eagerly installed it, ready to protect his personal information. However, from the moment Jonny started using Heliboard, things didn’t go as smoothly as he had hoped.

item.title: The Early Days of Paid Wifi With Starbucks
item.description: In the late 2000s, Starbucks emerged as more than just a coffee haven; it became a social hub, a place to connect with friends and colleagues. However, during this period, the concept of free WiFi was not as ubiquitous as it is today. Instead, Starbucks UK offered a WiFi experience that required payment for access. The Era of Paid WiFi at Starbucks UK.. Around 2006 and 2007, Starbucks introduced its WiFi service to stores across the UK & Ireland, offering customers the opportunity to access the internet while sipping their favorite beverages.
